Package org.apache.wiki.tags

Class CalendarTag

java.lang.Object
javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.TagSupport
org.apache.wiki.tags.WikiTagBase
org.apache.wiki.tags.CalendarTag
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.IterationTag, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.JspTag, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.Tag, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.TryCatchFinally
public class CalendarTag
extends WikiTagBase
Provides a nice calendar. Responds to the following HTTP parameters:
  • calendar.date - If this parameter exists, then the calendar date is taken from the month and year. The date must be in ddMMyy format.
  • weblog.startDate - If calendar.date parameter does not exist, we then check this date.
If neither calendar.date nor weblog.startDate parameters exist, then the calendar will default to the current month.
Since:
2.0
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • initTag

      public void initTag()
      This method is called when the tag is encountered within a new request, but before the setXXX() methods are called. The default implementation does nothing.
      Overrides:
      initTag in class WikiTagBase

    • setPageformat

      public void setPageformat​(java.lang.String format)
      Sets the page format. If a page corresponding to the format is found when the calendar is being rendered, a link to that page is created. E.g. if the format is set to 'Main_blogentry_'ddMMyy, it works nicely in conjuction to the WeblogPlugin.
      Parameters:
      format - The format in the SimpleDateFormat fashion.
      See Also:
      SimpleDateFormat, WeblogPlugin

    • setUrlformat

      public void setUrlformat​(java.lang.String format)
      Set the URL format. If the pageformat is not set, all dates are links to pages according to this format. The pageformat takes precedence.
      Parameters:
      format - The URL format in the SimpleDateFormat fashion.
      See Also:
      SimpleDateFormat

    • setMonthurlformat

      public void setMonthurlformat​(java.lang.String format)
      Set the format to be used for links for the months.
      Parameters:
      format - The format to set in the SimpleDateFormat fashion.
      See Also:
      SimpleDateFormat

    • doWikiStartTag

      public final int doWikiStartTag() throws java.io.IOException
      This method is allowed to do pretty much whatever he wants. We then catch all mistakes.
      Specified by:
      doWikiStartTag in class WikiTagBase
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
